intro: Hieracium neosonchoides, commonly known as the New Zealand hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a weed in some regions outside its native habitat.
